elements.title: national Māori flag (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the white design on the national Māori flag (pictured) is a traditional Māori koru, or fern frond, representing renewal and hope for the future?

elements.title: Fritz Pleitgen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Fritz Pleitgen, who interviewed Mikhail Gorbachev and Ronald Reagan, directed the broadcaster WDR from 1995 to 2007?

elements.title: Ridgefield Branch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that passenger service on the Ridgefield Branch was eliminated after the electrification of neighboring lines?

elements.title: in Rajkot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there are palaces named the Ranjit Vilas in Rajkot, in Ratlam and in Wankaner?

elements.title: Rick Buffington (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rick Buffington played for at least 17 minor league and semi-professional football teams, including three at once?

elements.title: Fir teg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the final scene in the 1931 Soviet Yiddish theatrical play Fir teg is said to evoke the mass suicide at the siege of Masada?

elements.title: Harry Booth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Harry Booth played for, captained, and coached the Saint Joseph's Hawks baseball and men's basketball teams?

elements.title: yellow bloodstain lichen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the yellow bloodstain lichen is not always yellow?
